organization.name: open-data-ni
organization.title: OpenDataNI
organization.description:
[OpenDataNI] (https://www.opendatani.gov.uk) is the brand name for the Open Data portal which facilitates easy access to Northern Ireland public sector data for both reuse and redistribution. 

OpenDataNI has been developed as part of the Digital NI initiative. Digital NI aims to help establish a culture within Northern Ireland that develops and enhances Digital capability not just through interactions with Government, but also with local companies and throughout communities. Within government the Digital Transformation Service is facilitating this cultural shift through a number of methods, transforming Government services, making data open and available and encouraging and coaching those who lack digital skills.

It is recognised that opening up our data is the right thing to do in terms of transparency, accountability and efficiency of the Public Sector in Northern Ireland. It has the potential to encourage new commercial opportunities and drive economic growth and innovation across public and private sectors.

result.title: Northern Ireland Transitional Waters 2009-2015

extras.value: Transitional waters defined under Article 2(6) of the Water Framework Directive for 1st cycle river basin plans(2009-2015).  These are no longer in use.  For the current transitional waters dataset, updated for the 2nd cycle river basin plans (2015-2021), please follow the link to DAERA's digital dataset download page https://www.daera-ni.gov.uk/articles/wmu-digital-dataset-downloads and click on the marine link **** NOTE THAT:  You must ensure that you read the terms and conditions applicable to data available via the DAERA website before using the data as that is not currently covered by UK Open Government Licence. ****

Transitional water features that had been created to comply with Article 2(6) of the Water Framework Directive were the basis of this dataset. It was required for the 1st cycle river basin plans (2009 - 2015).  The data was topologically corrected to remove gaps and overlaps from the original digitisation both with the features in the dataset and also with interbasins, river water bodies and coastal waters that were produced for the Water Framework Directive. Begin_Lifespan and End_Lifespan information was added to enable historical data to be kept along with current data in this resource.
